subject: Public Speaking
title: Demagoguery: Playing to the Crowd
description: A fast breakdown of Demagoguery: Playing to the Crowd for builders.

hook.text: A demagogue tells the crowd exactly what it wants to hear, then uses that love to seize power. History is full of them.

buildup.text: Demagogues exploit fear, blame outsiders, and promise simple fixes to complex problems. The formula is 2,500 years old.

discovery.text: Aristotle warned about demagogues. He said they thrive when people are angry, afraid, and feel their leaders failed.

twist.text: Demagogues often start with real grievances. They gain trust by naming genuine problems, then redirect anger selfishly.

climax.text: The defense against demagoguery is not less rhetoric â€” it's better rhetoric. Counter-persuasion, not silence.

punchline.text: The cure for bad speech is better speech, not silence.

quiz.question: What did Aristotle say allows demagogues to thrive?
options: When people are angry, afraid, and feel their leaders have failed
